valueExpression.name: criteriaMet
valueExpression.expression: (%isHighRisk or %isVulnerable) and (%recentSymptoms = true) and (%testResult = 'positive' or (%testResult = 'negative' and %householdContact = true))

extension.valueString: Enter result

name: ConsumerCOVIDRatResultQuestionnaire
title: Report a Rapid Antigen Test (RAT) result
purpose: Report a Rapid Antigen Test (RAT) result

extension.valueString: urn:uuid:observation-phone

item.text: Phone number
Enter result
The RAT result will be recorded against the official health record for this person.

valueExpression.expression: 'The RAT result will be recorded against the official health record for ' + %subjectName + '.'

item.text: RATs with other lines
If your RAT has other lines or markings, consult the product information leaflet.
Contact Healthline for further information on 0800 358 5453.
Other risk factors or medical conditions:
List of conditions

extension.valueString:
• chronic lung or airways disease
  • serious heart conditions
  • poorly controlled hypertension
  • chronic neurological or neuromuscular disease
  • diabetes
  • chronic kidney disease
  • severe liver disease such as cirrhosis
  • severe blood (haematological) disorders
  • severe mental illness
  • active cancer
  • morbid obesity (BMI greater than 35)
  • people currently in contact with secondary and tertiary mental health and addiction services
  • people with mental health and addiction issues who are currently homeless or without permanent housing.

item.text: Report a COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Test (RAT) result
A diagram showing what a positive COVID RAT Result looks like
Is the control line (C) visible?
Is the test line (T) visible?
Faint lines

extension.valueString: Faint lines

item.text: If a line is faint it should still be recorded as visible.
A small number of RATs have an ‘N’ line

extension.valueString: What to do if your RAT has other lines

item.text: Day test was taken
You can only report a test taken within the last 7 days.
Are you a household contact of someone who has tested positive for COVID-19?
Antiviral Eligibility
About these questions

extension.valueString: About these questions

item.text: The following questions will give you an indication of whether you might be eligible to receive free oral COVID-19 antiviral medicine.

extension.valueString:
The following questions will give you an indication of whether you might be eligible to receive free oral COVID-19 antiviral medicine.

More information about antivirals and eligibility criteria

item.text: Symptoms of COVID-19 can include one or more of the following:

extension.valueString: Symptoms of COVID-19 can include one or more of the following:

item.text: Sneezing and runny nose, sore throat, body aches, cough, feeling tired, headache, nausea and vomiting, diarrhoea, fever

extension.valueString:
• sneezing and runny nose
  • sore throat
  • body aches
  • cough
  • feeling tired
  • headache
  • nausea and vomiting
  • diarrhoea
  • fever

item.text: Visit this page for more information about COVID-19 symptoms:
COVID-19 symptoms

extension.valueString: COVID-19 symptoms

item.text: Have you been experiencing any symptoms?
When did you start experiencing any of these symptoms?
Select the date that your symptoms started
Antiviral Eligibility
About these questions

extension.valueString: About these questions

item.text: The following questions will give you an indication of whether you might be eligible to receive free oral COVID-19 antiviral medicine.

extension.valueString:
The following questions will give you an indication of whether you might be eligible to receive free oral COVID-19 antiviral medicine.

More information about antivirals and eligibility criteria

item.text: Eligible people include:

extension.valueString:
Eligible people include:

  • Māori or Pacific people aged 50 or over
  • anyone aged 50 or over, who has not had at least 2 COVID-19 vaccines
  • anyone aged 65 or over

item.text: Do any of these apply to you?
These are some reasons you might be at high risk of becoming very sick from COVID-19:

extension.valueString:
These are some reasons you might be at high risk of becoming very sick from COVID-19:

  • you have Down syndrome
  • you have sickle cell disease
  • you have previously been in critical or high dependency hospital care from COVID-19
  • you receive Disability Support Services funded by Whaikaha – Ministry of Disabled People (previously Ministry of Health) or need direct family, whānau or external disability care most days
  • you have frailty or vulnerability due to one or more severe health conditions
  • you have a weakened immune system
  • you have 3 or more of these risk factors or medical conditions

item.text: Do any of these apply to you?
Result: Failed. A result could not be determined.

extension.valueString:
Result: Failed

A result could not be determined.

item.text: Result: Positive. COVID-19 was detected.

extension.valueString:
Result: Positive

COVID-19 was detected.

item.text: Result: Negative. COVID-19 was not detected.

extension.valueString:
Result: Negative

COVID-19 was not detected.

item.text: Antiviral eligibility

extension.valueString: Antiviral eligibility

item.text: Based on the information you have provided, you may be eligible for free oral COVID-19 antiviral medication.
Not eligible

extension.valueString:
Based on the information you have provided, you are not likely to be eligible for oral COVID-19 antiviral medication.

Talk to your doctor, pharmacist or hauora provider by phone if you think this is incorrect.

Pharmacies where you do not need a prescription for antivirals

item.text: Recommended isolation

extension.valueString: Recommended isolation

item.text: We recommend you stay home and isolate for five days from either the date you developed symptoms or the date you tested positive, whichever was earlier. You can leave your recommended isolation on the sixth day if you are feeling well.

extension.valueString: We recommend you stay home and isolate for five days from either the date you developed symptoms or the date you tested positive, whichever was earlier. You can leave your recommended isolation on the sixth day if you are feeling well.

valueExpression.expression: 'We recommend you stay home and isolate for 5 days from ' + %dayZero.formatDate('dddd, D MMMM') + '. You can leave your recommended isolation on ' + %isolationLeaveDate.formatDate('dddd, D MMMM') + ' if you are feeling well.'

item.text: Recommended isolation

extension.valueString:
For 10 days you should stay away from healthcare facilities, aged residential care facilities, or anyone at risk of getting seriously unwell with COVID-19. If you must visit, phone ahead and remember to wear a mask.

Further COVID-19 information

item.text: We recommend you test daily for 5 days and stay at home until 24 hours after your symptoms are gone. If symptoms persist, continue to test.
What to do next

extension.valueString: What to do next

item.text: Talk to your doctor, healthcare provider, pharmacist, or hauora provider if you think that you, or a member of your whānau, may be eligible for antiviral medicines.You can get a prescription for antivirals from your doctor, healthcare provider, or hauora provider. Some pharmacies can supply antivirals without a prescription.

extension.valueString:
Talk to your doctor, healthcare provider, pharmacist, or hauora provider if you think that you, or a member of your whānau, may be eligible for antiviral medicines.

You can get a prescription for antivirals from your doctor, healthcare provider, or hauora provider. Some pharmacies can supply antivirals without a prescription.

Pharmacies where you do not need a prescription for antivirals

item.text: Continue to follow current advice: https://info.health.nz/conditions-treatments/infectious-diseases/covid-19/if-you-have-covid-19/

extension.valueString: Continue to follow current advice: If you have COVID-19

item.text: If symptoms persist, test again at 24 and 48 hours.

extension.valueString: If symptoms persist, test again at 24 and 48 hours.

item.text: Continue to follow current advice: https://info.health.nz/conditions-treatments/infectious-diseases/covid-19/testing-and-reporting/

extension.valueString: Continue to follow current advice: testing and reporting

item.text: Complete a new RAT and report the result.

extension.valueString: Complete a new RAT and report the result.

item.text: Call 111 if you find it difficult to breathe, pass out, or find it very difficult to wake up, are blue around the mouth, or very pale and cold, or are having severe chest pain.

extension.valueString: Call 111 if you find it difficult to breathe, pass out, or find it very difficult to wake up, are blue around the mouth, or very pale and cold, or are having severe chest pain.

item.text: Further support

extension.valueString: Further support

item.text: Monitor COVID-19 symptoms and if they get worse or you need medical care, call a healthcare provider or Healthline on 0800 358 5453.

extension.valueString: Monitor COVID-19 symptoms and if they get worse or you need medical care, call a healthcare provider or Healthline on 0800 358 5453.

item.text: Monitor for COVID-19 symptoms, and test if you become symptomatic.If you return a positive RAT, report the result using this form.

extension.valueString:
Monitor for COVID-19 symptoms, and test if you become symptomatic.

If you return a positive RAT, report the result using this form.

item.text: Call 111 if you find it difficult to breathe, pass out, or find it very difficult to wake up, are blue around the mouth, or very pale and cold, or are having severe chest pain.

extension.valueString: Call 111 if you find it difficult to breathe, pass out, or find it very difficult to wake up, are blue around the mouth, or very pale and cold, or are having severe chest pain.

item.text: Exit

extension.valueString: <exit-button reason='completed'>Return to results page</exit-button>
